abstract: Government reports and aviation publications say Bell 206 JetRanger, helicopter that crashed into Manhattan's East River, killing one passenger and injuring two others, is particularly susceptible to loss of tail rotor control; officials from National Transportation Safety Board have not yet found any conclusive cause for the crash and are continuing investigation.
snippet: The Bell 206 JetRanger is described as susceptible to a loss of tail rotor control, government reports say.
lead_paragraph: The Bell 206 JetRanger is described as susceptible to a loss of tail rotor control, government reports say.

headline.main: Type of Helicopter in Crash Is Prone to a Rotor Problem
headline.print_headline: Type of Helicopter in Crash Is Prone to a Rotor Problem
headline.seo: Model of Helicopter That Crashed Into River Is Prone to Tail Rotor Problem
